verses.verse: Behold,<WH2005> the LORD's<WH3068> hand<WH3027> is not shortened,<WH7114> that it cannot<WH3808> save;<WH3467> neither<WH3808> his ear<WH241> heavy,<WH3513> that it cannot<WH3808> hear:<WH8085>
But your iniquities<WH5771> have separated<WH914> between<WH996> you and your God,<WH430> and your sins<WH2403> have hid<WH5641> his face<WH6440> from you, that he will not hear.<WH8085>

For your hands<WH3709> are defiled<WH1351> with blood,<WH1818> and your fingers<WH676> with iniquity;<WH5771> your lips<WH8193> have spoken<WH1696> lies,<WH8267> your tongue<WH3956> has muttered<WH1897> perverseness.<WH5766>

None<WH369> calls<WH7121> for justice,<WH6664> nor<WH369> any pleads<WH8199> for truth:<WH530> they trust<WH982> in vanity,<WH8414> and speak<WH1696> lies;<WH7723> they conceive<WH2029> mischief,<WH5999> and bring<WH3205> forth<WH3205> iniquity.<WH205>

They hatch<WH1234> cockatrice'<WH6848> eggs,<WH1000> and weave<WH707> the spider's<WH5908> web:<WH6980> he that eats<WH398> of their eggs<WH1000> dies,<WH4191> and that which is crushed<WH2116> breaks<WH1234> out into a viper.<WH660>

Their webs<WH6980> shall not become<WH1961> garments,<WH899> neither<WH3808> shall they cover<WH3680> themselves with their works:<WH4639> their works<WH4639> are works<WH4639> of iniquity,<WH205> and the act<WH6467> of violence<WH2555> is in their hands.<WH3709>

Their feet<WH7272> run<WH7323> to evil,<WH7451> and they make haste<WH4116> to shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood:<WH1818> their thoughts<WH4284> are thoughts<WH4284> of iniquity;<WH205> wasting<WH7701> and destruction<WH7667> are in their paths.<WH4546>

The way<WH1870> of peace<WH7965> they know<WH3045> not; and there is no<WH369> judgment<WH4941> in their goings:<WH4570> they have made them crooked<WH6140> paths:<WH5410> whoever<WH3605> goes<WH1869> therein shall not know<WH3045> peace.<WH7965>

Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> is judgment<WH4941> far<WH7368> from us, neither<WH3808> does justice<WH6666> overtake<WH5381> us: we wait<WH6960> for light,<WH216> but behold<WH2009> obscurity;<WH2822> for brightness,<WH5054> but we walk<WH1980> in darkness.<WH653>

We grope<WH1659> for the wall<WH7023> like the blind,<WH5787> and we grope<WH1659> as if we had no<WH369> eyes:<WH5869> we stumble<WH3782> at noon<WH6672> day as in the night;<WH5399> we are in desolate<WH820> places as dead<WH4191> men.

We roar<WH1993> all<WH3605> like bears,<WH1677> and mourn<WH1897> sore like doves:<WH3123> we look<WH6960> for judgment,<WH4941> but there is none;<WH369> for salvation,<WH3444> but it is far<WH7368> off from us.

For our transgressions<WH6588> are multiplied<WH7231> before<WH5048> you, and our sins<WH2403> testify<WH6030> against us: for our transgressions<WH6588> are with us; and as for our iniquities,<WH5771> we know<WH3045> them;

In transgressing<WH6586> and lying<WH3584> against the LORD,<WH3068> and departing<WH5253> away from our God,<WH430> speaking<WH1696> oppression<WH6233> and revolt,<WH5627> conceiving<WH2029> and uttering<WH1897> from the heart<WH3820> words<WH1697> of falsehood.<WH8267>

And judgment<WH4941> is turned<WH5253> away backward,<WH268> and justice<WH6666> stands<WH5975> afar<WH7350> off: for truth<WH571> is fallen<WH3782> in the street,<WH7339> and equity<WH5229> cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> enter.<WH935>

Yes, truth<WH571> fails;<WH5737> and he that departs<WH5493> from evil<WH7451> makes himself a prey:<WH7997> and the LORD<WH3068> saw<WH7200> it, and it displeased<WH7489> <WH5869> him that there was no<WH369> judgment.<WH4941>

And he saw<WH7200> that there was no<WH369> man,<WH376> and wondered<WH8074> that there was no<WH369> intercessor:<WH6293> therefore his arm<WH2220> brought<WH3467> salvation<WH3467> to him; and his righteousness,<WH6666> it sustained<WH5564> him.

For he put<WH3847> on righteousness<WH6666> as a breastplate,<WH8302> and an helmet<WH3553> of salvation<WH3444> on his head;<WH7218> and he put<WH3847> on the garments<WH899> of vengeance<WH5359> for clothing,<WH8516> and was clad<WH5844> with zeal<WH7068> as a cloak.<WH4598>

According<WH5921> to their deeds,<WH1578> accordingly<WH5922> he will repay,<WH7999> fury<WH2534> to his adversaries,<WH6862> recompense<WH1576> to his enemies;<WH341> to the islands<WH339> he will repay<WH7999> recompense.<WH1576>

So shall they fear<WH3372> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> from the west,<WH4628> and his glory<WH3519> from the rising<WH4217> of the sun.<WH8121> When<WH3588> the enemy<WH6862> shall come<WH935> in like a flood,<WH5104> the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> shall lift<WH5127> up a standard<WH5127> against him.
And the Redeemer<WH1350> shall come<WH935> to Zion,<WH6726> and to them that turn<WH7725> from transgression<WH6588> in Jacob,<WH3290> said<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

As for me, this<WH2063> is my covenant<WH1285> with them, said<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> My spirit<WH7307> that is on you, and my words<WH1697> which<WH834> I have put<WH7760> in your mouth,<WH6310> shall not depart<WH4185> out of your mouth,<WH6310> nor out of the mouth<WH6310> of your seed,<WH2233> nor out of the mouth<WH6310> of your seed's<WH2233> seed,<WH2233> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> from now on<WH3254> and for ever.<WH5769>
